1. From my perspective, unfair trade policy:
 a) Small BASF store with reduced portfolio buying 6% cheaper through the Mundial distributor (campaigns buy 10 cans and get 1);
 b) New entrant (MC Paints) buying up to 14% cheaper;

 * Consequently, 2019 was the year in which we granted the largest discount on Suvinil products, causing a drop in margin and the need to recover this loss of profitability in other suppliers.

 c) 90-day interest-free period for the competitor;
 d) Sales in the old table 30 days after the table was turned over with the competitor's justification for not having a DC (Distribution Center). Inconsistency because whoever invests in the business (who has CD) is penalized.
 e) Weakening of the ELO program. Lack of transparency or perception of management policy in sight.
 f) Commercial and strategic proposal less attractive than other suppliers in the segment.

 2. There is a need for better training of the sales team
 a) When questioning the price difference that the competitor practices in selling to the consumer, the answer is another question: "Do you know the volume that MC buys nationwide?". There is inconsistency because obviously the participation of the new entrant in GO is smaller. And regional players do not compete in other markets (such as SP);
 b) There is no gratitude when the goals are reached, but there is a very aggressive and hostile demand when they are not; A real connection between sell in and sell out is missing. If you don't sell due to unfair commercial policy, it's no use charging sell in.
 c) The team lacks the value of simplicity.

 3. There is a lack of better training for the merchandising team
 a) Merchandising promoter rated all stores in the chain with a star on Google;
 b) Lack of professionalism with excessive proximity (case manager Rosimeire / Castelo Branco store: "Good morning, brunette / beautiful marvelous");
 c) Rudeness in the reopening of the T-63 store when using a product with the label of Melotintas' biggest competitor (Unitintas) in the application of products to a large number of final consumers and painters.
 d) Very low involvement in the reopening of the store: Arrived late, all wet/sweaty, did not do the texture and color plates (texture and color palette); On the eve, we hired a painter to make the Marble and Touch of Glitter apps.
 e) No involvement in the new store (Castelo Branco).

 4. From a strategic point of view:
 a) Conflict with the Distribution channel lasts for more than 5 years: Channel that has no success cases in the segment in the region of Goi√¢nia. There are several cases of failure both with Suvinil products (Luma, M√©cari, Mundial) and with other brands (3M, Renner, etc.); On average, the business barely reached 5 years.
 b) Low historical knowledge in the region: Common characteristic of those who were leaders in the region (Coral, Suvinil, Leinertex): all without the distribution channel, buying with a transparent and coherent policy.
